name: feverishly
content:
feverishly adverb
(ILL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is caused by a high body temperature: She lay on the bed sweating feverishly. His head throbbed feverishly.
More examplesFewer examplesHe could feel his mind racing feverishly.She pushed her hair feverishly from her forehead.His eyes burned feverishly.

feverishly adverb
(EXCITED/ACTIVE)
in an unnaturally excited or active way: work feverishly Airport employees worked feverishly to handle the unexpected traffic. She spent much of her time writing feverishly in a notebook. See
feverish
More examplesFewer examplesRescue workers dug feverishly for survivors.The groups negotiated feverishly into the early morning.They continued to save money feverishly.
